title: Confusing Neutraface
content:
So I really want to use neutraface for a corporate identity—from logo through to brochure copy.

However, the uppercase E really bothers me. It’s too modern. I think the face would be perfect if it weren’t for that one character, which is used in typesetting the company’s name.

On the House Industries website they show the large N from neutraface—but the text below it—that E is different, and I can’t seem to find an alternate version in the Try Font feature..

Is that neutraface or not? A different cut of Futura than what I have? (the R in that looks much better than mine).

What is that?

[http://www.houseind.com/include/getimage.php?id=8002](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021413/http:/www.houseind.com/include/getimage.php?id=8002 "http://www.houseind.com/include/getimage.php?id=8002")

| --- | --- |
| [getimage.php\_.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021413/http:/typophile.com/files/getimage.php__0.gif) | 2.84 KB |
author: evanbrog

comments.content:
Ah. I did not see there were other versions.  
THANK YOU!
